sentences.en: Colby was privy to the committee’s decisions.
sentences.cn: 科尔比知晓委员会的秘密决定。

sentences.en: I was made privy to it.
I was made privy to the secret.
I wasn't privy to the negotiations.
sentences.cn: 我对那些谈判并不知情.

sentences.en: Many believe that Prince Vajiralongkorn will Privy Council with his own men.
sentences.cn: 许多人认为,王储将以其自己的人马重组枢密院.

sentences.en: Only three people, including a policeman, will be privy to the facts.
sentences.cn: 只会允许3个人，其中包括一名警察，了解这些内情。

sentences.en: She was not privy to any information contained in the letters.
sentences.cn: 她未获准接触那些信的内容。

sentences.en: The Cabinet evolved from the Privy Council.
The privy - purse never influenced his judgment in law - suits involving money.
sentences.cn: 暗中交易从不会在有关经济的诉讼中影响他的裁判.

sentences.en: The Privy Seal is a seal fastened on all royal documents.
sentences.cn: 御玺是盖在所有皇室文件上的一种印.

sentences.en: The privy took proceedings against the company.
sentences.cn: 当事人对这家公司提起诉讼.

sentences.en: They are accused of being privy to the plot against the king.
sentences.cn: 他们被控欺君谋反、知情不举.

sentences.en: They were accused of being privy to the plot against the king.
sentences.cn: 他们被控欺君谋反、知情不举.

sentences.en: Very few of them are privy to the details of the conspiracy.
sentences.cn: 他们之中很少人知道密谋的详情.

sentences.en: Very few of them were privy to the details of the conspiracy.
sentences.cn: 他们中很少有人知道这一阴谋的详情.

words.tran_cn: 私人的；不公开的；秘密参与的

trans.tran_cn: 个人的，私人的，秘密参与的，（行为）暗中参与的，不公开的
有利害关系的人，<古>厕所
trans.tran_en: a toilet, especially one outside a house in a small separate building
